question:
Let \(f(x) = p + \fac{9}{{x - q}}\), fo \(x \e q\). The lie \(x = 3\) is a vetical asymptote to the gaph of \(f\).

Wite dow the value of \(q\).

[1]
a.

The gaph of \(f\) has a&bsp;\(y\)-itecept at \((0,{\text{ }}4)\).

Fid the value of \(p\).

[4]
b.

The gaph of \(f\) has a \(y\)-itecept at \((0,{\text{ }}4)\).

Wite dow the equatio of the hoizotal asymptote of the gaph of \(f\).

[1]
c.
markschems:
\(q = 3\)     A1     N1

[1 mark]

a.

correct expression for \(f(0)\)     (A1)

eg\(\;\;\;p + \frac{9}{{0 - 3}},{\text{ }}4 = p + \frac{9}{{ - q}}\)

recognizing that \(f(0) = 4\;\;\;\)(may be seen in equation)     (M1)

correct working     (A1)

eg\(\;\;\;4 = p - 3\)

\(p = 7\)     A1     N3
